links.*: A Description of the Island of Númenor

wikitext.*:
{{short description|Small Númenórean bird}}
[[Image:Kirinki.jpg|thumb|Kirinki portrayed in ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing|MERP]]'']]

'''Kirinki''' was one of the many species of birds that were native to [[Númenor]]. These tiny birds were not known to be found anywhere within [[Aman]] and [[Middle-earth]]. The kirinki were said to be no bigger than wrens, with bright scarlet feathers, and piping voices so high that they could hardly even be heard by [[Men]].<ref>{{UT|3}}</ref><ref>{{NM|P3xiii}}</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Kirinki'' is a [[Quenya]] word possibly meaning "little cutter". It is perhaps derived from ''[[KIR]]'' ("cut, cleave, pass swiftly through; shave; skim (surface), slip along, glide quickly"), ''[[-incë]]'' ("diminutive ending").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2896360835.html|articlename=Q. ''Kirinki'' n.|website=[[Eldamo]]|accessed=4 September 2022}}</ref><ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]], "[http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist]" at [[Ardalambion]] (accessed 13 March 2011)</ref>
